title: The Soulless Measure the Frontier
summary: calderon-imperium surveyors and clerks arrive first—stakes, ink, and cold smiles. They name Garrok soil “unused” and call the living marsh “waste.”

title: The Iron Ledger Takes Our Kin’s Fields
summary: calderon-imperium seizes great swaths of garrok-confederation land and drives the orcs deeper into the swamp-lows. They do it with paperwork and spearpoints alike—order written in blood, stamped and filed.

title: Blood on Unfinished Stone
summary: garrok-confederation strikes back at the calderon-imperium reach, hurling bodies against half-raised walls and wet mortar. Thousands die beneath arrows and falling stone; the Imperium counts the dead as if tallying grain.

title: The Road of Nails Through the Marsh
summary: calderon-imperium cuts a causeway into the swamp—trees felled, reeds burned, spirit-shrines trampled flat. Every plank is a promise: they intend to stay, and they intend to make the land obey.

title: The Quiet Cull of Dakgar
summary: the Imperium’s “pacifications” begin: night raids, bound captives, villages emptied for labor and “relocation.” Those who flee speak of soldiers with eyes like polished iron—no rage, no mercy, only procedure.

title: Tribute in Teeth
summary: calderon-imperium erects toll posts and ration yards, demanding “tax” for the crime of surviving on stolen ground. When the Garrok refuse, the Imperium answers with public hangings and private pits—less a war than a harvest.

title: Ironstead Rises on Dakgar Bones
summary: calderon-imperium begins raising their capital-fortress over the barrier ground of the dakgar tribe of the garrok-confederation. They pour foundations through ancestral barrow grounds and call it progress.

title: The Name “Ironstead”
summary: calderon-imperium declares the new fortress city Ironstead as their capital and future seat, even as the walls remain hungry and incomplete. To the Imperium, a thing is true once it is written; the land is forced to agree later.
